commitResults.messageTitle: Level-1. Skeletal version of Duke (Name of chatbot to be changed)
Level-2. Adding items into list and displaying list.
Level-2. Reverted back to if-else statements
Level 3. adding mark and unmark commands
Level-4. Categorise tasks into Deadlines, Events and Todos.
commitResults.messageBody: Changed implementation of command calling from if-else to switch case

commitResults.messageTitle: Updated inheritance for Tasks
Tried Automated TextUiTesting.
Level-5. Handling Errors (Basic) Only included minimal error handling.
commitResults.messageBody:
Warnings yet to be included:
- incorrect number of parameters (/) for task adding
- marking a task number that is longer than the list length
- marking an already marked task (and for unmarking)

commitResults.messageTitle: Level-6. New Delete Function
commitResults.messageBody:
Add support for deleting functions from the list.

New warning to implement:
- deleting a task that does not exist.

commitResults.messageTitle: A-Enums. Use Java enum for jobs
Level-7: Save generated list into txt file
commitResults.messageBody:
List generated will now save into a text file which can be viewed even after chat has ended

Other Relevant Info:
Incorporate more enums for tasks
Update code to follow standard Java Coding Conventions

commitResults.messageTitle: Level 8: Dates and Times
Level 8: Update Dates and Times for Deadlines
commitResults.messageBody:
Previously, no restriction was placed on deadline and event date and timings.

Now, user would have to enter date and timings in the format: yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm
and the user can check for deadlines due on a certain date or events that are ongoing on that date

commitResults.messageTitle: A-MoreOOP
commitResults.messageBody:
Make the Code more OOP
Refactor the code to extract out closely related code as classes

commitResults.messageTitle: Storage Loading: enable loading of previous list
commitResults.messageBody:
Due to changes made in A-MoreOOP, issues were generated for loading previous list.

Adjustment made to parse date value in stored previous list

Previous list dates are stored in "MMM dd yyyy, DAY_OF_WEEK, hh:mmAM/PM" rather than in "yyyy-MMM-ddTHH:mm", which is the required format of users when entering data.

This parsing method could be used to allow users to enter dates in the format that is stored in the lists, rather than in the current required format.  Might make this available in future commits.

commitResults.messageTitle: Parsing: fix parsing error for check command
commitResults.messageBody:
Error thrown when user calls check command

Update parsing error

commitResults.messageTitle: Gradle: A-Gradle
commitResults.messageBody:
Automate project builds using Gradle

Build and run Duke manually by using javac and java
Check style of code also done manually

Merge Gradle branch to automate build, run and checkstyle

Automation allows for simpler and faster builds

commitResults.messageTitle: Add JUnit Testing, Update Mark Command
commitResults.messageBody:
The following things have been added in this commit
* Add JUnit tests to test the behaviour of certain parts of code.
* Update Mark Command index to reflect expected behaviour.

Testing was manually by running Duke and performing tests.
Mark Command followed 0-based indexing, rather than the  expected 1-based indexing.

Incorporating JUnit Testing to allow fast and easy testing of previous codes
to ensure that code is not broken after new updates.
People would tend to count tasks using 1-indexing, rather than 0-indexing.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update Exception Catching for Task Creation
commitResults.messageBody:
Update ArrayOutOfBoundsException in Task.java to NullPointerException
to catch the appropriate error thrown for insufficient arguments supplied

Insufficient arguments error not caught, leads to exception thrown
and early termination of program

commitResults.messageTitle: Update condition and add Java docs in exceptions
commitResults.messageBody:
Update conditional statements in InsufficientArgumentException.java.
Add java docs in exception files for documentation.

Insufficient Argument Exception could be used incorrectly.
Missing java docs

Better error catching and Java docs for documentation

Earlier commit also had additions of java docs.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add javadocs for parser package files
Add javadocs for parser package files
Add javadocs for storage package files
Add Javadocs for tasks package
Add Javadocs for ui package
Tweak code to comply with java coding standard
Add Find Functionality
commitResults.messageBody:
Give users a new way to find a task by searching for a keyword.

Users only able to filter tasks using check command.

Users may want to filter their tasks based on keywords to look
through a smaller list of relevant tasks

Find Command created to give users a find a task functionality
so that they can search using a keyword to view filtered tasks
that contain the specified keyword

Merged CheckCommand into FindCommand since they have
simlar functionalities

commitResults.messageTitle: Level-10: GUI
commitResults.messageBody:
Implement JavaFX basics. Not yet applied to Duke

To use Duke, users are provided with the command line interface
which is not really user friendly and looks boring

Use JavaFX to introduce graphical user interface for users to
interact with, rather than a plain command line interface

Upcoming: GUI for Duke

commitResults.messageTitle: Level-10: GUI Updates
commitResults.messageBody:
Duke original functionaity can be performed on graphical user interface

Bare GUI implementation. No support for Duke's functionality.

We want Duke's functionality to be made available.

commitResults.messageTitle: Assertions
commitResults.messageBody:
Add assertion in Parser file

Unnecessary throw code.

May cause confusion in debugging.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update code to improve code quality
Remove redundant code
Add an extension: B-Reminders
commitResults.messageBody:
Add reminder functionality to remind users of either deadline tasks with a
deadline of the current day or event tasks that span over the current day.

Users have to search through their list on their own to view the such tasks.
They may forget to do so and miss out on tasks with deadlines

* Use Find Functionality upon initialisation of application to remind users
of such tasks
* Update Invalid Format Exception - Use of Java Varargs for Exceptions thrown
for Find Command
* Improve Code Quality

Reminders - Reminds users of such tasks upon starting the application so that they
can perform the various tasks required of them, before a task is overdue.
Update Exception - Exception is thrown for Find, Check Command, as well as
Add Command. Add Command requires LocalDateTime, while Find, Check Command can
accept both LocalDateTime and LocalDate.

Changes were also made to DialogBox.fxml to fix dialog box overflow
